<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 559]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 220, 603]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 106, 561, 144]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 163, 526, 180]]<|/det|>
\[W = \rho \Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 195, 536, 225]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 235, 526, 252]]<|/det|>
\[\rho = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 262, 561, 295]]<|/det|>
\[\rho = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 305, 536, 322]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 339, 615, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - \chi^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 384, 536, 420]]<|/det|>
\[f_{0} = \frac{f_{s}V}{\nu\pm\nu_{s}}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 430, 536, 465]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 472, 628, 490]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 502, 598, 521]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 532, 526, 559]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 574, 530, 591]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 607, 598, 626]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 640, 628, 658]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 670, 518, 704]]<|/det|>
\[V_{\mathrm{H}} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 718, 561, 735]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 752, 581, 770]]<|/det|>
\[x = x_{0}\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 780, 536, 814]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 272, 920, 305]]<|/det|>
A signal in an optic fibre is carried by an electromagnetic wave of frequency \(1.36 \times 10^{14} \text{Hz}\). The speed of the wave in the fibre is \(2.07 \times 10^{8} \text{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 318, 615, 336]]<|/det|>
For this electromagnetic wave, determine the ratio:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 344, 615, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\text{wavelength in free space}}{\text{wavelength in fibre}}.\]

The attenuation per unit length of the signal in the fibre is \(0.40 \text{dB} \text{km}^{-1}\). The input power is \(1.5 \text{mW}\) and the output power is \(0.060 \text{mW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 629, 460, 647]]<|/det|>

<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Two positively charged identical metal spheres A and B have their centres separated by a distance of \(24 \text{cm}\), as shown in Fig. 6.1.

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 246, 591, 265]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 277, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
The variation with distance \(x\) from the centre of A of the electric field strength \(E\) due to the two spheres, along the line joining their centres, is represented in Fig. 6.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[136, 322, 855, 711]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 728, 534, 746]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 759, 144, 778]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 759, 450, 778]]<|/det|>
State the radius of the two spheres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 789, 920, 808]]<|/det|>
<form>radius = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[900, 789, 920, 808]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 806, 89]]<|/det|>
The charge on sphere A is \(3.6 \times 10^{- 9} \text{C}\). Determine the charge \(Q_{\text{B}}\) on sphere B.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 801, 120]]<|/det|>
Assume that spheres A and B can be treated as point charges at their centres.

There is a current in the rod that causes a force on the rod. The balance is used to determine the magnitude of the force.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 752, 646]]<|/det|>
